item.title: No subscriptions? No problems! Here are the best movies and TV series you can watch for free
item.description: From family favourites to Australia's most controversial soap opera, here's some of the best movies and TV you can watch right now — no fee required!

item.title: Kununurra's Barra Bash barramundi competition underway as restocking solution sought
item.description: More than 1,000 fishers hope to reel in a winning catch at Lake Kununurra, where a restocking program and ideal conditions have grown record-size barramundi.

item.title: Anthony Albanese coy on critical minerals offer ahead of meeting with Donald Trump
item.description: The prime minister would not say exactly what Australia's critical minerals offer to the United States included — nor whether it was exclusive to the Trump administration, after he discussed the issue with his British counterpart.

item.title: Lions show they're the complete team by beating Cats to claim second straight AFL premiership
item.description: With contributors across the board, the Brisbane Lions clinically dismantled Geelong to show last year's premiership victory was no fluke.

item.title: It's OK on the Macleay poster vandalism prompts calls for queer acceptance
item.description: A regional queer community says acceptance is improving in regional areas, but vandalism targeting an LGBTQI+ event shows there is still a way to go.

item.title: Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco in star-studded ceremony
item.description: Singer, actor and beauty mogul Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco, with US media reporting Taylor Swift was in attendance at the star-studded affair.

item.title: From the BBC
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg says studying space will help Australia manage bushfires, floods
item.description: With Sydney to play host to the world's largest space conference this coming week, Katherine Bennell-Pegg says it is more important than ever to highlight the benefits of growing Australia's space workforce.

item.title: Australia's Kirra Wright claims silver at World Para Athletics Championships
item.description: At just 17, Kirra Wright reaches the podium at the world titles after setting a personal best in winning the silver medal in New Delhi.

item.title: Outback Festival draws thousands in Winton's 150-year milestone celebration
item.description: Forget balloon darts and whack-a-mole, at this bush carnival, you'll find swag throwing, dunny racing and cow-pat discus.

item.title: The benefits and risks of sleeping next to your dog
item.description: While there are several benefits to keeping our pets close at night, there are a few minor risks to consider.

item.title: Polar bears take over abandoned research station in Russian Arctic
item.description: A group of polar bears that have taken over an abandoned polar research station off Russia's coast is intimately captured in drone footage.

item.title: St Kilda pulls off record AFLW comeback, Ebony Marinoff, Ally Anderson celebrate milestone games
item.description: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time, while Ally Anderson and Ebony Marinoff become the first players to feature in 100 AFLW games.

item.title: Four-year-old boy missing in remote South Australian mid-north since Saturday
item.description: The boy was last seen at his family homestead at about 5pm on Saturday.

item.title: Adam Reynolds and Reece Walsh explain the Broncos' game-winning moment against Penrith Panthers
item.description: Adam Reynolds took the kicking tee from the Broncos' biggest star in the biggest moment of their season so far, and it paid off in the biggest way possible.

item.title: Vietnam evacuates thousands as Typhoon Bualoi approaches
item.description: As Typhoon Bualoi approaches Vietnam, thousands of people are seeking safer ground.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese vows to defend democracy at UK Labour conference
item.description: Anthony Albanese and British counterpart Sir Keir Starmer embrace on stage in Liverpool, northern England, where rumours have been swirling about a leadership challenge to the UK PM.

item.title: Classified US intelligence warns of China's preparations for Taiwan invasion
item.description: A classified US intelligence report, seen by the ABC, says vessels have been modified to carry tanks and partake in amphibious operations in what Taiwan considers part of China's "expansionist intentions".

item.title: Donald Trump's 'climate hoax' comments belong to a well-resourced playbook landing on Australia's shores
item.description: US researchers have tracked how dark money funds a tangled web of climate denial think tanks with vested interests in slowing climate action. And Australia is not immune.

item.title: If China beats the US on fusion energy, its supremacy will be assured
item.description: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

item.title: Anti-corruption chief Paul Brereton continued defence consulting after declaring he had resigned from role
item.description: The head of the national anti-corruption commission told a Senate inquiry he had resigned his role at the defence force's investigative arm. But the ABC has learned he continued consulting for them, and documents proving his resignation could not be identified.

item.title: Funding deal for research program about Australia's polar security rejected by Tasmanian government
item.description: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

item.title: How Astrid Jorgensen turned a suburban pub choir into a worldwide musical phenomenon
item.description: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition — she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

item.title: Jewish patients say they feel ongoing fear months after Bankstown Hospital nurses video
item.description: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

item.title: Outback temperatures near 40C as Queensland school holidays continue
item.description: Clear, bright and sunny skies are expected as the Sunshine State's school holidays continue this week.

item.title: The deadly legacy of the 'forgotten pandemic' — and why it's drawing comparisons to COVID-19
item.description: It's been dubbed "the forgotten pandemic" — possibly because it coincided with some of the most momentous events in world history. But Dr John Gerrard argues variants of the H3N2 flu, which led to the Hong Kong flu pandemic, continue to cost lives.

item.title: Mark Nawaqanitawase outlines what he misses most about rugby union on Nesian Footy show
item.description: Mark Nawaqanitawase says there are many things he misses about rugby union, but moving to league is the best decision he has made in his life.

item.title: These Australians are homeless with a house
item.description: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for today's climate, let alone the future.

item.title: Southern pygmy perch 'ear bones' provide data to re-establish populations
item.description: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.

item.title: Two charged with murder over Morwell stabbing incident that left one man dead
item.description: Homicide detectives have charged two males aged 16 and 19 with murder following the stabbing of an 18-year-old man in Victoria's east on Saturday night.

item.title: Shellharbour Council proposes tiny home planning pathway in NSW first
item.description: Shellharbour Council approves a plan for a tiny homes planning pathway which it says could be adopted statewide, as owners face uncertainty around legal installation.

item.title: Government quietly extends Nauru contract, taking the cost to $787m — as it happened
item.description: The government has quietly extended a contract for the running of asylum seeker services on Nauru until 2027, taking the cost to $787 million.

item.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid after unpopular tenure
item.description: Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid, but says he will "continue to fight for this city" until his term ends on January 1, 2026.

item.title: ASX jumps 0.9 per cent ahead of tomorrow's RBA rates decision, gold surges — as it happened
item.description: The ASX bounced out of the blocks, supported by banks and healthcare stocks gaining 0.9 per cent, while gold hit a new record high.

item.title: Ivan Cleary says NRL doctor's decision to rule Scott Sorensen out of preliminary final was a 'huge call'
item.description: Ivan Cleary says the NRL made a "huge call" in deciding to bench Scott Sorensen after a nasty head clash.

item.title: Children's author Pamela Allen's work showcased in interactive exhibition at State Library of NSW
item.description: At 91, Pamela Allen has published more than 60 books. This exhibition brings her work off the page and invites children and adults to play as they read.

item.title: National campaign against indicator flash as unofficial overtaking signal
item.description: Road haulage industry leaders are planning a national campaign against using indicators as a signal it is safe to overtake.

item.title: India defeats Pakistan with just two balls to spare in cricket's Asia Cup final, then refuse to claim trophy
item.description: India defeats Pakistan with just two balls remaining in the Asia Cup final, then refuses to claim the trophy.

item.title: WA growers take precautions against mango twig tip dieback disease
item.description: Mango growers in Western Australia's far north are on alert as a mysterious dieback disease decimates crops in the Northern Territory.

item.title: Man charged with murder, attempted sexual assault after alleged attack at Manly West shopping centre
item.description: Police allege the man stabbed a 44-year-old at a suburban Brisbane shopping centre before attempting to sexually assault a woman not known to him.

item.title: Vets warn dog owners as canine ehrlichiosis spreads across northern Australia
item.description: The rapid spread of canine ehrlichiosis since it was first detected in Australia five years ago "has left a lot of destruction in its wake", a veterinarian says.

item.title: The NRL grand final clash between Melbourne and Brisbane is the ultimate clash of footballing styles
item.description: Neither Melbourne nor Brisbane is approaching perfection ahead of their grand final showdown, but with what they've been through, neither team would want to.

item.title: Price of silver nearing record high – 29 September 2025
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Death of woman found in Hobart Rivulet not being treated as suspicious
item.description: Police provide an update after a review of CCTV, statements from witnesses, and the results of an autopsy after the discovery of a woman's body on Friday.

item.title: Three people charged with murder of Jayden Selfe in Attadale after body found in bush
item.description: Three people face a Perth court accused of murdering 33-year-old Jayden Selfe, whose disappearance sparked an extensive investigation and led to the discovery of his body north of the city.

item.title: If you're looking to try out a career change, volunteering can give you a taste
item.description: If you're considering a career change, or want a taste of a new industry, volunteering can be a great option.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will tell US military leaders 'we love them' after Pete Hegseth summoned them for a meeting
item.description: The US president said he will tell military leaders "we love them, they're cherished leaders" during a meeting organised by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: Humanity's space ambition to be focus of first Powerhouse Parramatta exhibition
item.description: Humanity's ambition to explore beyond Earth will feature in the largest exhibition space in the country when Powerhouse Parramatta opens in the city's west.

item.title: Investigation begins after Townsville urology patients not given test results, follow-up care
item.description: Queensland Health will investigate reports patients did not receive crucial test results from north Queensland's largest public hospital.

item.title: Bad Bunny to headline Super Bowl Halftime show in 2026
item.description: Grammy-winning rapper Bad Bunny is set to headline the Super Bowl half-time show in Northern California next year.

item.title: When is the 2025 NRL grand final? Here's how to watch and everything you need to know
item.description: The NRL and NRLW grand final teams have been finalised and are getting ready to face-off this weekend. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Melbourne Storm prop Stefano Utoikamanu labels Brisbane Broncos 'stuck up', Xavier Willison free to play NRL grand final
item.description: Melbourne prop Stefano Utoikamanu lights the fuse for an explosive NRL grand final on Sunday, setting his sights on steamrolling "stuck-up" Brisbane opponents.

item.title: Unregulated melatonin products had as much as four times the amount on label, TGA testing shows
item.description: The TGA has urged patients to stop using unregulated melatonin products after testing revealed “significant discrepancies” between their actual melatonin amount and what was on the label.

item.title: Death of Port River dolphin prompts calls for stricter boat regulations
item.description: The "completely preventable" death of a three-year-old dolphin in Adelaide's Port River has prompted new calls for mandatory propeller guards on boats entering the sanctuary.

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day services around Australia pay tribute to fallen officers
item.description: Three police officers shot dead in the line of duty this year are being honoured as part of National Police Remembrance Day services around Australia.

item.title: NRL players, including Brisbane Broncos star Payne Haas, spruik crime-linked fashion line R4W Active
item.description: The grand final-bound Origin prop and at least three other NRL players are promoting a clothing brand linked to the Alameddine crime family, fuelling police concern the league has failed to stem the influence of organised crime.

item.title: Kylie Soanes is an urban ecologist on a mission to prove nature belongs in our cities
item.description: Kylie Soanes says urban development should not come at the expense of nature and there's no reason why we should not spot a fairy wren on the way to the bus stop.

item.title: How can we better prepare tourists at Cradle Mountain?
item.description: Cradle Mountain is one of Tasmania's most popular, and dangerous, tourism destinations. After another tragedy, questions are asked about what more could be done to ensure the safety of visitors.

item.title: Youth advocate calls for balance amid knife crackdown, police conduct 1,600 searches at Burnside
item.description: SA Police conducted more than 1,600 metal detector searches at Burnside Village at the weekend, but the state's Guardian for Children and Young People says officials need to "get the balance right" amid a crackdown on knife crime.

item.title: India claim they were denied Asia Cup trophy after win over Pakistan
item.description: India T20 skipper Suryakumar Yadav has claimed that his team was denied the chance to lift the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, after it beat Pakistan in the final by five wickets on Sunday.

item.title: Lismore looks to the future as flood buyback suburbs empty out
item.description: A rainforest minutes from the CBD, a food production bowl and riverside walkways are among the big ideas being discussed for Lismore as it continues to recover from the 2022 floods.

item.title: Body scanner to be used in ACT courts after significantly reducing prison strip searches
item.description: The ACT government will expand the use of electronic body scanners to the courts after their use in Canberra's only prison saw a dramatic drop in the need to strip search prisoners.

item.title: At least 13 dead after Typhoon Bualoi makes landfall in Vietnam
item.description: At least 13 people have died after heavy rain and strong winds from the former Typhoon Bualoi flooded roads, knocked off roofs in central Vietnam, state media reported, with residents describing it as "one of the strongest".

item.title: Climate change is hitting the Northern Territory harder than most places in Australia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Noemie Fox leads Aussies to kick off ICF Slalom World Championships
item.description: Noemie Fox has just missed out on a dream start to the ICF Slalom World Championships, finishing fifth in the kayak cross time trials.

item.title: Will Ashcroft named best AFL finals player to win Gary Ayres Award to add to Brisbane Lions accolades
item.description: Brisbane Lions midfield star Will Ashcroft has added the AFL coaches' award for player of the finals to his growing list of accolades in the wake of his team's 47-point victory over the Geelong Cats on Saturday.

item.title: James Tedesco is named best NRL player by his peers for the fourth time despite Roosters falling short in NRL finals
item.description: The 32-year-old fullback joins Johnathan Thurston as the only four-time winner of the players' champion award, after the Sydney Roosters star was voted the NRL's best player of 2025 by his peers.

item.title: Albanese invites Emirati retail giant Lulu Hypermarket to take on Coles and Woolworths
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Emirati 'hypermarket' chain LuLu Group to set up shop on Australia's shores and take on supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths.

item.title: Caboolture Hospital to review medical scans amid concerns about outpatient service
item.description: A clinical team is reviewing the medical imaging results of up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital amid concerns about how results were communicated.

item.title: Monday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Rick Morton's book about Robodebt, Mean Streak, among Prime Minister's Literary Award winners
item.description: Journalist Rick Morton didn't want to write a book about Robodebt. Now that book, Mean Streak, has won the Prime Minister's Literary Award for non-fiction.

item.title: US to impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside the country, Trump says
item.description: US President Donald Trump initially threatened to impose such levies earlier in May but offered few details, leading to confusion among entertainment industry executives.

item.title: Inside Iran, a paranoid regime hunts for traitors and spies after its war with Israel
item.description: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

item.title: Will the Reserve Bank cut interest rates today? Only if hell freezes over
item.description: With markets pricing next to no chance of an interest rate cut today, what are the chances of another RBA move before year's end?

item.title: What could Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children, look like?
item.description: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan
item.description: Israel has agreed to a US proposal to end its war on Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump announce after holding talks at the White House.

item.title: Clock is ticking for Optus boss as triple-0 disaster escalates
item.description: Analysts say the Optus CEO should "leave quietly" now or risk a more public exit once the reviews into the company's recent outages are complete.

item.title: Consultancy bill to review 'struggling' submarine agency blows out to $12.1 million
item.description: The agency responsible for delivering AUKUS has spent five times what it first planned for consultants to review its operations.

item.title: Pro-EU party wins majority in Moldova election in setback for Russia
item.description: Moscow is accused of attempting to sway the election in favour of a pro-Russian party, but a majority of voters backed the pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity.

item.title: Calvary St Luke's Hospital surgeries transferred after micro tears found in the floor
item.description: The shutdown of Calvary St Luke's Hospital will affect 40 planned surgeries this week, with 22 of those reallocated to nearby St Vincent's Hospital.

item.title: Tom Ballard's new show searches for the line between funny and offensive while pushing the comedy envelope
item.description: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

item.title: Hawthorn Hawks AFLW lose Emily Bates to injury
item.description: Top-four aspirants Hawthorn are set to lose Emily Bates for the run towards the finals after the star midfielder suffered a shoulder injury.

item.title: Australian homes could soon be built by spider-like robot called Charlotte
item.description: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

item.title: Queensland government writes off up to $4 million worth of COVID-19 fines years after they were issued
item.description: The government has confirmed Queensland's state-run debt collection agency has now "finalised" all debts related to COVID fines.

item.title: Teenage boys charged over car chase through Melbourne into Bourke Street Mall
item.description: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.

item.title: 'Huge change' to Australia's health system as registered nurses set to prescribe medication
item.description: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

item.title: First Nations Australians launch class action against Work for the Dole scheme
item.description: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

item.title: Looming crisis for older Australian women who will retire into poverty if no urgent action taken, new report finds
item.description: Women's super balances are disproportionately impacted by events later in life, in addition to childcare duties, which could mean serious financial problems, research from Super Members Council (SMC) has found.

item.title: Rescue founders outraged as kitten Pierre dumped within hours of adoption
item.description: Just 12 hours after he was adopted, eight-month-old kitten Pierre was found in his carrier in the middle of the road, drenched after an overnight storm. Rescuers are urging owners to de-sex their cats, to help prevent other animals from enduring a similar ordeal.

item.title: Federal environment minister knew of rock art fears before granting Woodside North West Shelf extension
item.description: The federal environment minister was advised pollution from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant may be causing irreversible changes to ancient rock art, before granting the company a 40-year extension with strict conditions.

item.title: Will Skelton to return for Wallabies against All Blacks in second Bledisloe Cup Test
item.description: Lock Will Skelton is set to return for the Wallabies ahead of the final round of the Rugby Championship against the All Blacks.

item.title: Agnes Water hospital plans in limbo as council rejects development approval extension
item.description: Hundreds of homes targeting the over-50s market are in staged construction on Queensland's central coast, but a council will not grant an extension for hospital plans.

item.title: Search continues for missing four-year-old boy Gus on property near Yunta
item.description: Police are continuing to search for a four-year-old boy who vanished while playing in sand at his family's isolated sheep grazing property near Yunta in a remote part of South Australia's north.

item.title: Federal politics: Coalition says government 'spending spree' behind no interest cut — as it happened
item.description: The Coalition says Labor's "spending spree" is behind the Reserve Bank of Australia's decision to keep interest rates on hold at 3.6 per cent.

item.title: Mitch Brown hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over 'homophobic' social media post from Geelong Mad Monday
item.description: Mitch Brown, the first AFL player to reveal he is bisexual, hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over a social media post from Mad Monday.

item.title: Moorambilla Voices bush choir marks 20 years as former student credits it with saving his life
item.description: Justin Welsh says joining the Moorambilla Voices children's choir helped steer him away from the challenges that face many young men in small country towns.

item.title: NATO embraces new Australian-made Star Wars-style lasers to counter Russian drones
item.description: A Canberra-made laser is about to become NATO's newest frontline defence against enemy drones, in a deal experts say could transform the future of warfare.

item.title: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold, RBA governor says property market at 'difficult' point — as it happened
item.description: The Reserve Bank left the cash rate steady at 3.6 per cent at its latest board meeting, as expectations of a November rate cut declined.

item.title: Green carab beetles release tear gas smell in Geraldton while escaping heat
item.description: Often mistaken for a stink bug or Christmas beetle, this iridescent insect has descended on Geraldton with a tear gas-like odour.

item.title: Taliban imposes communication shutdown in Afghanistan after severing fibre optic connections
item.description: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have imposed a nationwide shutdown of communications, weeks after they began severing fibre optic connections.

item.title: NSW Police release CCTV footage of drive-by shooting at Sydney home linked to drug dealers
item.description: Police have released footage showing the moment a gunman fired on a suburban Sydney home in July, with investigations into the matter continuing.

item.title: A tip cat and a depot duck become invaluable workmates
item.description: A playful tabby kitten and a ravenous Muscovy duck routinely amuse council staff in their respective workplaces.

item.title: Broncos second-rower Jordan Riki opens up about his quest for redemption in the 2025 NRL grand final
item.description: After suffering a heartbreaking loss in the 2023 NRL grand final, Jordan Riki says redemption is fuelling Brisbane's journey to the 2025 title.

item.title: Advocate calls out Kimberley's 'astronomical' fruit and vegetable prices
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis means fresh produce is more expensive for all Australians, but residents in some remote WA towns are paying up to triple for some items compared to city prices.

item.title: Alcoa confirms permanent shutdown of Kwinana alumina refinery, south of Perth
item.description: US aluminium giant Alcoa says there is no "sustainable" path to restarting its aluminium refinery in Perth after phasing out production at the facility.

item.title: Glenn Maxwell out of NZ T20 International series after breaking arm
item.description: A brutal run of injuries continues for one of Australia's top white-ball cricketers, who is out of the T20 series against New Zealand.

item.title: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics 'disrespectful' and 'embarrassing'
item.description: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics "disrespectful" and "embarrassing", after a slew of social media posts raises eyebrows across the AFL community, including one referencing his Seven colleague Caroline Wilson.

item.title: Trump's peace plan shows Netanyahu has outmanoeuvred yet another American president
item.description: For all US President Donald Trump's boasts about ending wars and being a worthy candidate for a Nobel Peace Prize, he has failed to end the war in Gaza and build a sustainable future for both Israelis and Palestinians. At least for now.

item.title: Why Bad Bunny is a controversial choice to headline Super Bowl half-time show
item.description: Grammy-award winning rapper and singer Bad Bunny receives mixed reactions to the news he will headline the 2026 Super Bowl half-time show.

item.title: Police investigating deaths of mother and daughter at Kenmore Hills house listed on Airbnb
item.description: Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane.

item.title: Optus board expresses 'confidence' in CEO Stephen Rue to lead repair job
item.description: After it was initially unclear whether Optus and its Singaporean parent company, Singtel, had confidence in chief executive Stephen Rue, the board has confirmed in a statement its support for the embattled CEO to lead the task to restore confidence in Optus.

item.title: James Tedesco pulls out of Kangaroos selection for Ashes to be best man at brother's wedding
item.description: Former Kangaroos captain James Tedesco has informed the Australian Rugby League that he will not be available for the upcoming Ashes series in England.

item.title: James Turner wins first gold medal for Australia at World Para Athletics Championships
item.description: Paralympic champion James Turner wins Australia's first gold medal of the World Para Athletics Championships, saluting in the 400m T36 event in Delhi.

item.title: NSW government loses music festival strip search case as woman awarded $93,000 in damages
item.description: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.

item.title: How Brisbane's culture of empowerment has allowed its youngsters to be fearless on the AFL's biggest stage
item.description: Brisbane's youngest players rise to the occasion on the biggest stage, led by its 21-year-old Norm Smith medallist Will Ashcroft. Here's how the two-time premiers allow their kids to thrive.

item.title: RBA holds interest rates in September, market bets on one more cut
item.description: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold at 3.6 per cent, having cut them at its previous meeting in August, while market pricing for a November cut also fades.

item.title: Calls for investigation after thousands of scans may not have been reviewed by doctors at Caboolture Hospital
item.description: Queensland's premier has called for an independent investigation into the problem, affecting up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital dating back to April 2023.

item.title: What is the Riyadh Comedy Festival? The Saudi Arabia event stirring controversy in Hollywood
item.description: The Riyadh Comedy Festival stars A-list comedians like Peter Davidson, but despite its blockbuster acts, it has copped backlash for what one human rights organisation says is a "whitewashing" of a "brutal repression of free speech".

item.title: Geelong is known for its accessibility on Mad Monday, but Bailey Smith's posts have unravelled years of goodwill
item.description: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday — now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

item.title: Missing boy's family releases statement as search continues in mid-north SA
item.description: The devastated family of a missing four-year-old boy has released a statement saying it is holding on to hope "he will be found and returned safely" as authorities and community members continue the search in mid-north South Australia.

item.title: 'Complex' brief of evidence after group charged with stealing crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park
item.description: Four men, including a pilot who survived a fatal chopper crash in 2022, are facing Commonwealth charges for allegedly stealing saltwater crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park.

item.title: Australia ready to defend Women's Cricket World Cup trophy in India
item.description: Australia's all-conquering generation of women's cricketers has one last Cricket World Cup feat to tick off, setting their sights on defying almost 40 years of history to win back-to-back ODI tournaments.

item.title: West Coast Eagles handed extra draft pick, four rookie list spots to help climb up ladder
item.description: The West Coast Eagles are handed an extra first-round draft pick and four additional rookie list spots from the AFL, in a bid to help the ailing club return to competitiveness after four dismal years.

item.title: Australian film industry fears Donald Trump's movie tariff threatens jobs
item.description: The multi-billion-dollar Australian film industry searches for details after the US president announced he would impose a 100 per cent tariff on movies made outside America.

item.title: Speaking to others without kids helped me find a future after IVF
item.description: The more people I spoke to, the less frightened I felt of my future. I could shift my focus to what I can do because I don't have a kid, instead of what I was missing out on.

item.title: Former British PM Tony Blair named as part of Donald Trump's Gaza recovery authority
item.description: US President Donald Trump has unveiled his proposed peace plan for Gaza — pitching the return of a former British prime minister as its coordinator.

item.title: Jessica Ann Walker among trio accused of murdering Jayden Selfe in Attadale
item.description: Pictured riding on a luxury boat and posing on the deck of a multi-million-dollar home with sweeping views of the Swan River, life appeared good for Jessica Ann Walker in 2022 — but just three years later she would be charged with murdering a man.

item.title: Melbourne Storm and Brisbane Broncos name NRL grand finals teams, NRLW teams announced
item.description: Brisbane Broncos' mid-year recruit Ben Talty has been dropped for this Sunday's NRL grand final, making way for the returning Pat Carrigan.

item.title: Rescuers search for missing students a day after Indonesian boarding school collapses during prayers
item.description: Indonesian rescuers are scrambling to locate 91 people feared trapped under rubble after an Islamic boarding school collapsed in the East Java town of Sidoarjo.

item.title: Kash Patel gave New Zealand officials 3D-printed guns illegal to possess under local laws
item.description: On a visit to New Zealand in July, FBI Director Kash Patel presented three senior security officials with 3D-printed guns that were later destroyed.

item.title: Noemie Fox in the mix for podium at ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships
item.description: Noemie Fox is on track for a podium finish in the canoe event at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships in Sydney, provided the Australian star can clean up her errors.

item.title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban separate after 19 years of marriage
item.description: A source close to the couple tells the ABC the separation was not a mutual decision, saying it was Urban's decision to leave the relationship.

item.title: Clean-up underway after 'devastating' industrial spill in Far North Queensland
item.description: Building company Boral works to clean up thousands of litres of kerosene and bitumen that have spilled into a creek in Cairns, connecting to an inlet that leads to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Prosecutors seek over 11 years in prison for Sean 'Diddy' Combs as victims deal with nightmares and fear retribution
item.description: New York prosecutors cite one of Sean "Diddy" Combs accusers who says she lives in fear of his release from detention as the music mogul's case returns to court for sentencing.

item.title: Hundreds gather in Morwell to remember life of 18-year-old Kaiden Morgan
item.description: Friends and family have gathered in Victoria's east to remember the life of a beloved young man who died in an alleged attack on the weekend.

item.title: Michele Bullock on relationship between interest rates and property prices.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock warns housing supply improvement is likely to be several years away
item.description: In a rare candid moment, the Reserve Bank governor concedes that, despite the best efforts of policy makers, chronic housing undersupply will continue for at least the next two years.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Trump’s Gaza peace plan comes with Hamas ultimatum
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Is AI changing the future of the arts?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: The stargazers protecting the Earth from a possible asteroid impact
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: More sunscreens pulled from shelves over SPF concerns
item.description: Ten further sunscreens have either been pulled from shelves or "paused" from supply to retailers over concerns about their sun protection claims, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) announces.

item.title: China bans all BHP iron ore cargoes as pricing dispute escalates
item.description: China is the world's largest iron ore consumer and buys about 75 per cent of global seaborne iron ore, while BHP is the world's largest listed miner.

item.title: House prices to climb as expanded first home buyer scheme kicks off
item.description: Home values have gained for the eighth month in a row. Experts warn that a rush of first home buyers signing up to the Home Guarantee Scheme will only fuel price growth.

item.title: Hegseth declares an end to 'politically correct' leadership in the US military
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of US military officials to an in-person meeting to declare an end to "woke" culture in the military.

item.title: AI tool detects tiny brain lesions to help children with epilepsy live seizure-free
item.description: Melbourne researchers test a new AI tool that detects tiny lesions in children with epilepsy, leading to surgeries that leave them seizure-free.

item.title: Public prostate cancer patients told treatment provided by public hospitals no longer available
item.description: Men with aggressive prostate cancer who were being treated with a groundbreaking drug have been told the therapy is no longer available at public hospitals.

item.title: $50m fund for clean energy apprenticeships remains untouched
item.description: A $50 million fund to support students wanting to study clean energy trades is yet to pay out a single dollar, nearly a year and a half after it was funded in the budget.

item.title: Communications Minister Anika Wells finds herself in the eye of Optus political storm
item.description: Touted in some insider circles as future Labor leadership material, self-identified millennial Anika Wells finds herself in a storm over the nation's emergency triple-0 system.

item.title: Will Australia's democracy survive global collapse?
item.description: This year's Boyer Lectures will consider whether our democratic system will hold in the face of global headwinds.

item.title: Nervous wait for families of Israeli hostages, Palestinians over Gaza peace plan
item.description: With Hamas yet to provide its response to Donald Trump's peace plan, affected civilians on both sides of the war share their concerns and hopes for the future.

item.title: When it comes to business, size does matter — and smaller isn't necessarily better
item.description: The economic contribution of start-ups has been overlooked, as a new study suggests age and performance should be taken into consideration when it comes to incentive policy.

item.title: Inside a children's court, a magistrate hears of fearful victims and young people living with trauma
item.description: The ABC spent a week inside the court that presides over youth crime and witnessed fearful victims, young people living with trauma and magistrates facing the difficult to decision to bail or remand.

item.title: Australia and Türkiye try to break diplomatic stalemate over COP31 climate summit hosting rights
item.description: Australia and Türkiye are at loggerheads over who will host the massive international event, with insiders suggesting the countries could share the hosting rights.

item.title: Two years since Tasmania's commission of inquiry, report reveals which recommendations are still underway
item.description: Victim-survivor Katrina Munting says she remains hopeful, but she is concerned the government isn't implementing the commission of inquiry's recommendations quickly enough.

item.title: Hegseth takes aim at 'fat generals and admirals' at Pentagon
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Afghanistan is without mobile or internet access nationwide. Here's how it affects the country
item.description: Internet and mobile services have been cut across the country, a move human rights groups say will severely impact women and girls in particular.

item.title: Oscar Piastri feeling positive ahead of Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri believes McLaren "on paper" should be suited to the high temperatures expected for this weekend's Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

item.title: Kiama resident launches petition to disqualify MPs convicted of serious crimes
item.description: Disgraced former MP Gareth Ward was paid a weekly salary of more than $3,000 while waiting to be sentenced for sexual offences. An Illawarra resident wants to ensure that never happens again.

item.title: When do I need to do my tax return by? Here's what you need to know
item.description: The 2024/25 tax deadline is fast approaching, and missing the cut-off date could end up costing you. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Australia's southern coast is in uncharted waters
item.description: The disastrous algal bloom that has been lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, leaving many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

item.title: South Australia looks to defend Sheffield Shield and One Day Cup titles
item.description: South Australia is looking to repeat its success and win the Sheffield Shield title, after a decade-breaking win last season.

item.title: Terminally ill caravan park resident allowed to list her home for sale, Supreme Court rules
item.description: A court has granted Roslyn Grima the right to list her caravan park home on the market, but whether she can legally make a sale remains in dispute.

item.title: Inner West Council narrowly approves plan to build 31,000 apartments
item.description: The controversial housing plan that would see 31,000 apartments built in the inner west was passed by one vote on Tuesday night.

item.title: American ex-Neo-Nazi Jeff Schoep condemns rise in extremism in Victoria
item.description: Former US Neo-Nazi leader Jeff Schoep urges the Australian media not to publicise the actions of Neo-Nazis, after attending protests to gain insights into extremism in Victoria.

item.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage
item.description: The Oscar-winning actor files for divorce in a Nashville court a day after reports emerged of the couple's separation, with a source saying the decision to leave was Keith Urban's.

item.title: How Shane Perry worked as a mortgage broker, played without a contract and helped Brisbane to an NRL premiership
item.description: Only three men have steered Brisbane to a premiership, and Shane Perry is the only one who has done it while working a full-time job and playing without a contract.

item.title: Queensland tourist towns feel the pinch six months after record wet season
item.description: A wetter-than-average summer is brewing, and disaster-struck communities in Queensland's north have barely recovered from record rain earlier this year.

item.title: Footprint found but search for missing boy moving to 'recovery' phase
item.description: The search for a four-year-old boy who remains missing in South Australia's north days after he disappeared is shifting towards a "recovery" phase despite the discovery of a footprint, police have said.

item.title: Lithgow schools teach teenagers to build drones in transition away from coal
item.description: Students are looking to aero technology for new skills in Lithgow, where almost half the local economy is driven by the declining coal industry.

item.title: US Government shutdown looms
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: India beats Sri Lanka in Women's Cricket World Cup opener after rain delays
item.description: India recovers from a disastrous collapse to beat Sri Lanka in a rain-shortened first game at the Women's Cricket World Cup in Guwahati.

item.title: WA Police find 'insufficient evidence' to charge officer in alleged choking complaint after road incident
item.description: A man who alleges he was choked by an off-duty police officer in front of his daughter says he has lost trust in the police force, after they found "insufficient evidence" to lay charges over the road incident.

item.title: Sydney's heritage-listed urinal tells story of Australia's public loos
item.description: Tucked away at Dawes Point, under Sydney Harbour Bridge, is one of the city's most unexpected heritage-listed sites: a cast-iron urinal.

item.title: Why Phoebe Litchfield's first ODI World Cup could signal a new era in Australian cricket
item.description: Having burst onto the scene as a 16-year-old batting alongside Brian Lara, Phoebe Litchfield was a cricketing prodigy. At her first ODI World Cup, she has a chance to become a world beater.

item.title: Van Gogh painting among 'rarely seen' collection of art to be exhibited in Adelaide
item.description: A "rarely seen" collection of works from renowned artists Vincent van Gogh, Claude Monet and Henri Matisse will be on display in Adelaide next year, as part of 57 works on loan from the Toledo Museum of Art in the US.

item.title: Federal politics live: PM says deposit scheme will only cause 'slight increase' in house prices
item.description: Anthony Albanese defends the impact of the expansion of the government's home guarantee scheme, saying it will only lead to a "slight increase" in house prices. Follow live.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: DimSimLim shares secrets to restaurant quality Asian food in new cookbook
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Many waiting longer than clinically recommended for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra
item.description: After 36 years working as a house cleaner, Judy Harman needs a knee replacement, but there are hundreds of people in front of her on the wait list for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra.

item.title: Markets live updates: BHP shares slide as miner tight-lipped on China ban reports, PM 'concerned'
item.description: Anthony Albanese says any restriction on iron ore markets is disappointing, as BHP remains tight-lipped. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Yulella Aboriginal Corporation's 'Vision' shop combats cost of remote living
item.description: A community group in an outback town is fighting high prices to offer more affordable food, clothing, and other essentials that were previously only available hundreds of kilometres away.

item.title: Napheesa Collier criticises WNBA boss Cathy Engelbert, league leadership after play-offs exit
item.description: WNBA superstar Napheesa Collier goes scorched earth on the league's leadership, criticising a lack of accountability and revealing some alarming comments by commissioner Cathy Engelbert.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ransomware hackers strike Toowoomba pharmacy as businesses warned of new tactics
item.description: Small businesses are being warned to re-evaluate their cybersecurity systems after hackers targeted a regional Queensland pharmacy.

item.title: Health battle heralds end of an era for family-run festival favourite Wignalls Wines
item.description: WA vigneron Rob Wignall, who built a legacy of award-winning Great Southern wines and star-studded music festivals, says it is time to move on.

item.title: The US is on the brink of a government shutdown. Here's what that means
item.description: The US is on the brink of its first government shutdown in more than six years as politicians duel over federal funding. Here's what that means.

item.title: Truck driver dies in fiery Hume Freeway crash near Wangaratta
item.description: The truck smashed into two trucks parked on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta and caught fire.

item.title: Widow petitions for MRI machine at regional Queensland hospital
item.description: A year before her husband died, Helen Schmidt was forced to make a gut-wrenching decision after learning there was no MRI machine at their regional hospital.

item.title: Vanessa Low wins long jump, Chad Perris silver at World Para Athletics
item.description: Vanessa Low wins her fourth long jump world title as four athletes win gold for Australia at the World Para Athletics.

item.title: Rio Tinto's Gladstone coal-fired power station could be retired early
item.description: Queensland's largest and oldest coal-fired power station could be retired six years earlier than expected.

item.title: Prime minister 'concerned' by reports of Chinese ban on BHP iron ore imports
item.description: China's state iron ore buyer has ordered steelmakers to pause purchases of iron ore shipments from BHP, according to media reports, as they continue hardball negotiations with the company.

item.title: AFL ditches centre bounce for men's game, and sub rule after grand final criticism
item.description: The AFL will no longer have the traditional bouncedown to start men's games, and has also ditched the controversial sub rule.

item.title: Powerful Philippines earthquake leaves at least 20 people dead
item.description: The quake, which struck the central Cebu province, injured many others and sent residents scrambling out of their homes and into the darkness as the intense shaking cut off power.

item.title: Mount Gambier football referee Bill Stephenson hangs up whistle after 35 years
item.description: Bill Stephenson started refereeing to support his kids' dreams and he worries abuse will stop more like him from taking up the whistle.

item.title: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon sworn in, vows to tackle organised crime and domestic violence
item.description: In a ceremony on Wednesday, Police Minister Yasmin Catley paid tribute to the new commissioner, recalling the "bad bastards" he chased down in his career.

item.title: Hollywood veteran Bruce Beresford slams Donald Trump's plan for 100pc tariff on movies made outside US
item.description: Renowned Australian director and screenwriter Bruce Beresford says US President Donald Trump's plan to impose a 100 per cent tariff on all foreign-made movies cannot be done.

item.title: How Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban's relationship began and unfolded over 19 years
item.description: The recent split of much-loved Aussie couple Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban has left the world in shock. Here's a look back on their nearly two-decade relationship.
